title: How Air Pollution Threatens Natural Pest Control Methods in Sustainable Farming

tasks.task: Understand the impact of air pollution on natural pest control in sustainable farming.
subtasks: Research the health effects of air pollution on humans.
Note the effects of air pollution on the environment and biodiversity.
Identify how air pollution disrupts plant and animal migratory patterns.
Explain the role of air pollution in altering wildlife habitats.
Recognize the threat to non-toxic pest management techniques in organic farming.
Analyze the impact of air pollution on plant health.
Detail the effects of pollutants like ozone, particulate matter, and nitrogen dioxide on crops.
Understand the connection between air pollution and increased pest infestations in stressed crops.
Describe the decline in effectiveness of organic pest control methods due to air pollution.
Examine the case study of ladybugs struggling to find food and reproduce in polluted environments.
Discuss the importance of maintaining natural pest control for sustainable agriculture.
Consider the future implications of air pollution on sustainable farming practices.
